title: Simranjeet Bilkhu
text:
About Me
I’m currently in my final few months of my Master’s in Statistics at McMaster under the supervision of Dr. Pratheepa Jeganathan. This has been a rather good program. I (and hopefully my cohort) have acquired a lot of good practical skills in our modelling courses, both in coding as well as communication. I’ve also been given great introductions to probability theory, stochastic processes, and bayesian nonparametrics from non other than Dr. Noah Forman, and Dr. Shui Feng. I really have learned a lot taking this track, and perhaps I’ve learned an equal amount about myself. I began to realize why exactly I’m drawn to doing all this hard stuff; it’s because I love learning with a reckless abandon. I love breaking complex concepts down, and understanding things right from the ground up. Abusing this analogy, I would describe my learning process as follows:
Suppose I was given the process of building a house by myself. Of course, since I don’t have the current knowledge on how to build one, my task would be first would be to find a house (preferably abandoned), and start taking it apart.



Made with ChatGPT 5


Perhaps being a subject of my own confirmation bias, I hold the opinion that my passion for learning the inner workings of things gives me an edge in this era of generative AI. I seldom allow myself to use something without first understanding how it works.
So now the question is: why did I choose statistics as my main target of obsession? Truth be told, part of it, like all decisions, was chance (I’m going to refrain from making a probability joke here). I just so happened to be lucky enough to stumble across a field with such depth that it continues to amaze me the further I go. I love the fact that I can improve myself as a statistician by challenging myself mathematically, or by improving my programming knowledge.
But of course, it’s good to have other passions asides from statistics as well. Along with projects and resources apt for my professional portfolio, you may find some sections of this site non-career related, so feel free to take a look!
